title: Interview.Setup
body:
<<if $suspect == "Logan">>
    <<interviewSuspect InterviewSceneController Logan>>
<<elseif $suspect == "Nora">>
    <<interviewSuspect InterviewSceneController Nora>>
<<elseif $suspect == "Rachael">>
    <<interviewSuspect InterviewSceneController Rachael>>
<<elseif $suspect == "Lola">>
    <<interviewSuspect InterviewSceneController Lola>>
<<endif>>
[[Interview.Sit]]

title: Lola.Interview
body:
Why am I here?
Seriously, how? There's no way you can trigger my variable..
[[Game.Exit]]

title: Logan.Interview
body:
What is this about detective?
->I have evidence that you were behind Jacob Wright's death
    What? That's preposerous! I'll have your badge for this!
    ->You fought with Jacob on the night of his death.
        What about it? Are you saying I beat him to death?
        ->I am indeed.
            You're a madman. This will never stand up in court...
[[Game.Exit]]

title: Rachael.Interview
body:
You'd better have a good reason for dragging me in here, detective.
->The jig is up Rachael. I know you killed Jacob Wright.
    Ha, and you think I'll just confess to you? You can't prove anything.
    ->We found your rifle.
->I have evidence that you were the one who killed Jacob Wright.
    And what evidence would that be?
    ->We found your rifle.

...What?
I knew I should have dumped it in the river...
Fine... I killed him.
He just wouldn't step back on his decision. It was going to cost the company millions.
He gave me no choice...
[[Game.Exit]]

title: Nora.Interview
body:
Can this hurry along, I've got a flight to catch soon.
->I'm afraid you won't be going anywhere, Miss Hastings.
    What the hell? On what grounds?
    ->I've have evidence that you are behind Jacob's death.
        And what evidence would that be?
        ->I found the syringe in your apartment.

Damn it...
Fine, I killed him.
He spun all these lies about our future together, but he never really wanted that.
He was just stringing me along to keep himself interested.
I'm glad he's dead...
[[Game.Exit]]
